title: LEGO Time at Ocean Park
location: Ocean Park Branch Library, 2601 Main Street, Santa Monica, CA 90405
description: Build a city by the sea at a branch by the sea with LEGO! All materials provided. For ages 18 months - 11 years old.

title: Teen Movie Night: Mamma Mia! (2008)
location: Main Library, 601 Santa Monica Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90401
description: Join us for a showing of the musical hitMamma Mia!. Food and beverages will be provided. Rated PG-13. For ages 13 - 18. Supported by the Friends of the Santa Monica Public Library. Mamma Mia!

title: Tuesday Tales: A Travelin' Storytime
location: Main Library, 601 Santa Monica Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90401
description: This fun and engaging series of stories, songs, and rhymes travels to different library locations. Limited space; first come, first served. For ages 3 - 5.

title: Tuesday Tales: A Traveling Storytime
location: Main Library, 601 Santa Monica Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90401
description:
This engaging & fun weekly series of stories, songs and rhymes 
travels to different library locations. Limited space; free tickets 
available at 10:15 a.m. For ages 2-5.

title: Tech & Tasks
location: Pico Branch Library, 2201 Pico Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90405
description: Volunteer tutors provide help with reading documents or written tasks, using mobile devices, navigating government websites, filling out forms, using email, writing resumes and more. Assistance provided on a drop-in, first arrival basis.

title: Clutch Coding Week
location: Main Library, 601 Santa Monica Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90401
description: Clutch Coding is a fun coding class in Scratch led by students! No experience needed. Each date offers a different game so feel free to sign up for multiple days. Registration required. Space is limited. To register, emaillibrary@santamonica.govwith the name, age of attendee, and date(s) of attendance. All materials provided. For ages 6 – 11. Clutch Coding is a student-led nonprofit organization that introduces elementary school students to the exciting world of coding. Through fun and engaging lessons in Scratch and Python, Clutch Coding empowers kids to solve problems and build confidence with technology, no prior experience needed. Classes are led by passionate high school volunteers and designed to inspire the next generation of innovators in a supportive, hands-on learning environment. Clutch Coding is committed to making computer science accessible to everyone. library@santamonica.gov

title: SMPL at the Beach
location: Annenberg Community Beach House, 415 Pacific Coast Highway, Santa Monica, CA 90402
description: Southern California's only beachside pop-up library is heading back to the Beach House for a day of bookish fun in the sun! Sign out books from our beach reads collection (no library card required), make nautical crafts, play games, or kick back, relax and read in our Surfside Lounge. Seaside Storytime at 10:15 a.m. All ages welcome.

title: Pollinator Gardening with Santa Monica Community Gardens
location: Montana Branch Library, 1704 Montana Avenue, Santa Monica, CA 90403
description: Volunteers from the Santa Monica Community Gardens discuss how to attract hummingbirds, bees, and butterflies to your gardens, followed by hands-on activities with their California Climate Action Corps Fellows. Fellows will discuss species selection, planting and maintenance of a variety of native species.  Whether you are interested in butterflies, bees or hummingbirds, small spaces can be magical spaces with just a few small changes. Help us as we look to increase Pollinator Habitat throughout Santa Monica.  An Emerald Necklace connecting communities will help all of our gardens grow. A partnership of the Santa Monica Public Library, Office of Sustainability and the Environment and the California Climate Action Corps.

title: Community Conversation at Montana Branch Library
location: Montana Branch Library, 1704 Montana Avenue, Santa Monica, CA 90403
description: Enjoy light refreshments, connect with neighbors, and learn about SMPL'sCommunity Mappinginitiative! Share your feedback through a brief survey or join a guided discussion with library staff. Your input will help us map our library's future and better meet the needs of our community. Supported by the Friends of the Santa Monica Public Library. Community Mapping

location: Main Library, 601 Santa Monica Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90401
description: Hands-on practice with using a computer mouse and keyboard to navigate a Windows desktop and Web browser.

title: LEGO Club
location: Main Library, 601 Santa Monica Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90401
description: Join us for our popular LEGO club. Explore the limits of your building imagination or try out one of our suggested builds. All materials provided. For ages 18 months - 11 years old.

title: Santa Monica Public Library Board Meeting
location: Fairview Branch Library, 2101 Ocean Park Blvd, Santa Monica, CA 90405
description: This is a special meeting of the Library Board held on the second Thursday of the month at 6 p.m. at the Fairview Branch, Community Room, 2101 Ocean Park Blvd. The public is welcome to attend. Agenda and minutes are availablehere. The Fairview Branch is wheelchair accessible. For special disability accommodations, please contact Library Administration at (310) 458-8606 at least three days prior to the scheduled meeting. Clickherefor Big Blue Bus route and schedule information.

title: Literary Lounge
location: Main Library, 601 Santa Monica Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90401
description: Discover the joy of social reading at the Literary Lounge; a space for bibliophiles to bond over books, with music and refreshments. Bring your own book or choose one from a collection of staff favorites.Supported by the Friends of the Santa Monica Public Library.

title: Music Time with Miss Kym
location: Pico Branch Library, 2201 Pico Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90405
description: Accompanied by her keyboard, Miss Kym guides children and their caregivers in singing, dancing, and creative expression, blending her original songs with classic children’s tunes. For ages 5 and under. Supported by the Friends of the Santa Monica Public Library.

title: Ukulele 101 with Cali Rose
location: Main Library, 601 Santa Monica Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90401
description: Get started playing the "happiest instrument in the world.”  Learn how to hold your uke, read a chord chart, and play three songs! Bring your own instrument, borrow one of ours (supplies are limited), or check out a Ukulele RED Kit from the Library. For adults and teens. Cali Rose is an award-winning songwriter and a recording artist. She teaches ukulele online and is the founder and leader of The CC Strummers, a Los Angeles-based ukulele group with an international following. Seecalirose.com. calirose.com

title: Notable Fiction Book Group
location: Virtual
description: This community-led, monthly book discussion group meets virtually at 11 a.m. on the third Saturday of the month. This book group discusses prize-winning fiction titles. To register, emaillibrary@santamonica.gov. The titles include: July 2025:The Friendby Sigrid Nuñez August 2025:A Strangeness in My Mindby Orhan Pamuk September 2025:West with Giraffesby Lynda Rutledge October 2025:Long Islandby Colm Tóibín November 2025:Horseby Geraldine Brooks December 2025:Checkout 19by Claire-Louise Bennett library@santamonica.gov

title: Summer Film Series: Sing Sing (2023)
location: Main Library, 601 Santa Monica Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90401
description: Colman Domingo stars in this true story as Divine G, a man wrongly convicted of murder, whose life is transformed by leading a prison rehabilitative theatrical arts program. The film was co-written and stars the real-life inmates whose stories inspired the multiple-Oscar nominee. Run time: 107 min. Stay after the screening for a discussion of the movie and its themes. Supported by the Friends of the Santa Monica Public Library.

title: Main Library Book Group
location: Virtual
description: This community-led, book discussion group meets virtually at 7 p.m. on the third Monday of the month. This book discusses a wide range of books, chosen by the members. To register, emaillibrary@santamonica.gov. The titles include: August 2025:Gilgamesh: The Life of a Poemby Michael Schmidt September 2025:Mornings in Jeninby Susan Abulhawa October 2025:The Man Who Mistook his Wife for a Hatby Oliver Sacks November 2025:Tar Babyby Toni Morrison December 2025:The Sum of Our Days: a Memoirby Isabel Allende library@santamonica.gov

title: Mystery & Thriller Book Group
location: Virtual
description: This community-led, monthly book discussion group meets virtually at 7 p.m. on the third Tuesday of the month. This book group discusses domestic and international titles in the mystery and thriller genres. To register, emaillibrary@santamonica.gov. The titles include: August 2025:Everyone In My Family Has Killed Someoneby Benjamin Stevenson September 2025:We Lie Hereby Rachel Howzell Hall library@santamonica.gov

title: Citizenship Class
location: Pico Branch Library, 2201 Pico Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90405
description: An ongoing series of citizenship classes taught by Adult Education Center instructors. Classes are free and students must be 18 years or older to attend. Community parents and Santa Monica Malibu Unified School District parents have priority enrollment. The classes help students study the 100 civics questions, practice the dictations, review the citizenship application, and prepare for the interview. Enrollment is through the SMMUSD Adult Education Center, located at 2510 Lincoln Blvd., Room 116. Contact Maria Barajas atmbarajas@smmusd.orgor (310) 664-6222, ext. 76205 to enroll. mbarajas@smmusd.org

location: Main Library, 601 Santa Monica Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90401
description: Santa Monica Public Library hosts an ongoing series of English as a Second Language (ESL) conversation classes taught by Adult Education Center instructors. Enrollment is through the Santa Monica-Malibu Unified School District Adult Education Center, located at 2510 Lincoln Blvd., Room 203, Santa Monica, CA, 90405. title: Summer Film Series: Persepolis (2007)
location: Main Library, 601 Santa Monica Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90401
description: Marjane Satrapi’s bestselling graphic memoir of the same name inspires this Oscar-nominated animated film about a young Persian girl growing up during Iran’s Islamic revolution. In Farsi, French, and German, with English subtitles. Run time: 96 min. For ages 13 and up. After the film screening, teens ages 13 – 18 are invited to join adiscussion about the bookat the Main Library’s Community Room. Supported by the Friends of the Santa Monica Public Library. discussion about the book

location: Main Library, 601 Santa Monica Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90401
description: A legal research specialist helps patrons find answers to legal questions.Legal research specialists are not attorneys and cannot provide legal advice, help fill out forms or interpret the law.
